page.title: 14Isobel Marchioness of Graham
page.content: {The Grahams of Montrose}held land in the upper Endrick valley for much of Scottish recorded history. The family had{two castles.}One is just to the east of our square at{GR 682,859}the other at{GR 641,864,}belonged to a junior branch of the family. When they left they took the name{Fintry}with them.{Part of Dundee is now named {after our village. In{1982,}Lady Graham left to live near her son, heir to the{Duke of Montrose, near Loch Lomond. A dedicated worker for{Moral Re-armament}for many years, Lady Graham also organised the{Garden {Scheme for Scotland}from 1939 to 1953. The charities supported include the {Queen's Institute of District Nursing. { The family association with Fintry village continues, as Lady Graham's grandson uses the title{Lord Fintrie.
